sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend_layout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend_layout Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getPosition position} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend_layout_position (default: right)
    • {@link #getPriority priority} : int (default: 1)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend_layout.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'stacked_column'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.Combination.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Combination Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.Combination.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'combination'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Chart sap.viz.ui5.Combination

noData.description: Control tree to display when there is no data available
noData.helpDescription: Control tree to display when there is no data available

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

width.description: Width of the Chart as a CSS size.
width.helpDescription: Width of the Chart as a CSS size.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

height.description: Height of the Chart as a CSS size.
height.helpDescription: Height of the Chart as a CSS size.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

showTooltip.name: showTooltip
showTooltip.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

sap.viz.ui5.HorizontalArea100.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.HorizontalArea100 Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Area
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getIsIndependentMode isIndependentMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsPercentMode isPercentMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsKeepFirstAndLastLabel isKeepFirstAndLastLabel} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getLineSize lineSize} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getColor color} : string (default: #6c6c6c)
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_type (default: value)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_position (default: bottom)
    • {@link #getIsTruncateAvailable isTruncateAvailable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getForceLabelArea forceLabelArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableLabelSelection enableLabelSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHideTitleFirst hideTitleFirst} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxSizeRatio maxSizeRatio} : float (default: 0.25)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_title
    • {@link #getGridline gridline} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline
    • {@link #getAxisline axisline} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_axisline
    • {@link #getLabel label} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_label
    • {@link #getIndicator indicator} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_indicator
    • {@link #getScale scale} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_scale
    • {@link #getLayoutInfo layoutInfo} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_layoutInfo
    • {@link #getAxisTick axisTick} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_axisTick
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Module sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis

SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar_animation.description: Settings for animations in the plot area
sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar_animation.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar_animation Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataLoading dataLoading} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDataUpdating dataUpdating} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizing resizing} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar_animation.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Settings for animations in the plot area

sap.viz.ui5.types.Background.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Background Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getDirection direction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_direction (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColor color} : string (default: transparent)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBorder border} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Background.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

direction.description: Set the direction of the color gradient in the background. This only takes effect if the 'drawingEffect' value is set to 'glossy'.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHideWhenOverlap hideWhenOverlap} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsDonut isDonut} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: value)
    • {@link #getAutomaticInOutside automaticInOutside} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowZero showZero} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsGeoChart isGeoChart} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsBubbleChart isBubbleChart} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsStackMode isStackMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsPercentMode isPercentMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPositionPreference positionPreference} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOutsideVisible outsideVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getOutsidePosition outsidePosition} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel_outsidePosition (default: up)
    • {@link #getPaintingMode paintingMode} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel_paintingMode (default: rectCoordinate)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel_position (default: inside)
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getRespectShapeWidth respectShapeWidth} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFormatString formatString} : any[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

formatString.description: Set the format strings for the data labels. For dual axis charts, the first array is applied to the primary axis and the second array is applied to the second axis. If you enter fewer format strings into an array than there are measures in the respective axis, then the last format string is applied to all remaining measures. The following characters are reserved as tokens for format code: MDYHSAmdyhsa#?%0@. The following is a simple example: [["0.00%"],["0.00%"]].
formatString.helpDescription: Set the format strings for the data labels. For dual axis charts, the first array is applied to the primary axis and the second array is applied to the second axis. If you enter fewer format strings into an array than there are measures in the respective axis, then the last format string is applied to all remaining measures. The following characters are reserved as tokens for format code: MDYHSAmdyhsa#?%0@. The following is a simple example: [["0.00%"],["0.00%"]].

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap_animation Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataLoading dataLoading} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDataUpdating dataUpdating} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizing resizing} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. sap.viz.ui5.DualColumn.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualColumn Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.DualColumn.helpDescription:

They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'dual_column'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

    • {@link #getValue value} : any
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getIdentity identity} : string
    • {@link #getFormat format} : any
    • {@link #getRange range} : any[] (default: [])
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShape shape} : string[] (default: ???)

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

colorPalette.description: Set the color palette for the various sectors. For example, ["#748CB2", "#9CC677", "#EACF5E", "#F9AD79", "#D16A7C"].
colorPalette.helpDescription: Set the color palette for the various sectors. For example, ["#748CB2", "#9CC677", "#EACF5E", "#F9AD79", "#D16A7C"].

legendValues.description: Set the MBC legend values. For example, [10,11,12,13,14,15]. The values in the array should be in ascending order. If the number of values in the array is smaller than the MBC legend segment number, the MBC legend automatically calculates the values according to the data. If the number of values in the legendValues array is larger than MBC legend segment number, then only the first "segment number + 1" values are used.

If the number of values in the legendValues array is larger than MBC legend segment number, then only the first "segment number + 1" values are used.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_animation
    • {@link #getDataShape dataShape} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_dataShape
    • {@link #getBar bar} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_bar
    • {@link #getLine line} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination_line
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.Scatter.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Scatter Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getDataTransform dataTransform} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.

Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Abstract base class for all elements that represent VIZ modules or complex property types

sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_tooltip.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_tooltip Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValueFormat valueFormat} : string (default: n)
    • {@link #getPercentageFormat percentageFormat} : string (default: .0%)
    • {@link #getFormatString formatString} : string[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getIsRoundCorner isRoundCorner} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getImageFill imageFill} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getImagePalette imagePalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_animation
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:

The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Treemap Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Treemap
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support.   • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getIsRoundCorner isRoundCorner} : boolean (default: false)

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar_animation
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.Area.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Area Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Area
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_animation.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. sap.viz.ui5.Donut.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Donut Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getDataTransform dataTransform} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.DualStackedColumn.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualStackedColumn Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:

The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFormatString formatString} : string
    • {@link #getIsHierarchical isHierarchical} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsScrollable isScrollable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common_position (default: right)
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common_type (default: ColorLegend)
    • {@link #getAlignment alignment} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common_alignment (default: start)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common_drawingEffect (default: normal)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common_title
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Module sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common

sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : string (default: #d8d8d8)
    • {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth} : int (default: 1)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLeft left} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border_left
    • {@link #getRight right} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border_right
    • {@link #getTop top} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border_top
    • {@link #getBottom bottom} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border_bottom
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Background_border.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Settings for the border

sap.viz.ui5.Heatmap.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Heatmap Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.Heatmap.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'heatmap'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Chart sap.viz.ui5.Heatmap

showTooltip.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

sap.viz.ui5.Pie.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Pie Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getDataTransform dataTransform} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.Pie.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'pie'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Chart sap.viz.ui5.Pie

sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform_dataSamp.description: Settings for the data sampling algorithm
sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform_dataSamp.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform_dataSampling Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnable enable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSizeFactor sizeFactor} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getNumberPrecondition numberPrecondition} : int (default: 3000)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGrid grid} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform_dataSampling_grid
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Datatransform_dataSamp.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Settings for the data sampling algorithm

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

numberPrecondition.description: If the data point is larger than this value, data sampling is triggered.
numberPrecondition.helpDescription: If the data point is larger than this value, data sampling is triggered.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

enable.description: Set whether data sampling is enabled.
enable.helpDescription: Set whether data sampling is enabled.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

sizeFactor.description: Set the data point percentage in the original dataset
sizeFactor.helpDescription: Set the data point percentage in the original dataset

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

sap.viz.ui5.DualCombination.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualCombination Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Combination
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

showTooltip.name: showTooltip
showTooltip.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}
