sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDisable disable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFirstLine showFirstLine} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowLastLine showLastLine} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_gridline_type (default: line)
    • {@link #getColor color} : string (default: #d8d8d8)
    • {@link #getSize size} : int (default: 1)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame.description:
VizFrame is a viz control that manages a visualization’s initialization, layout, feeding, customization and interactions.

For more information on the available info chart types, see the following documentation.
sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/controls/VizFrame. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVizType vizType} : string (default: column)
    • {@link #getVizProperties vizProperties} : object
    • {@link #getVizScales vizScales} : object
    • {@link #getVizCustomizations vizCustomizations} : object
    • {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDataset dataset} : sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset
    • {@link #getFeeds feeds} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.FeedItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:renderComplete renderComplete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl#constructor sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame.helpDescription:

For more information on the available info chart types, see the following documentation.

Type for viz frame. User can pass 'chartType' or 'info/chartType'. For example both 'bar' and 'info/bar' will create a info bar chart.
Supported chart type: column, dual_column, bar, dual_bar, stacked_bar, stacked_column, line, dual_line, combination, bullet, bubble, time_bubble, pie, donut,
timeseries_column, timeseries_line, timeseries_scatter, timeseries_bubble,
scatter, vertical_bullet, dual_stacked_bar, 100_stacked_bar, 100_dual_stacked_bar, dual_stacked_column, 100_stacked_column,
100_dual_stacked_column, stacked_combination, horizontal_stacked_combination, dual_stacked_combination, dual_horizontal_stacked_combination, heatmap,
waterfall, horizontal_waterfall

context.description:
Additional data which works with data context in this dataset. The input could be an array. Each item represents a dimension that is added as the additional information based on data context. The input could be a string of dimension id,
or object like this {id: "name", showInTooltip: true}. If showInTooltip is false, the dimensions set in this API will not show in 
popover or tooltip. However other dimensions in data context will show. In selection event, all dimension information (including the dimension set in this API) will be included.
Context will be shown by default in tooltip if only set context with string or string of array.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Line.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Line Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getShowGroupDetail showGroupDetail} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line_tooltip
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line_animation
    • {@link #getMarker marker} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line_marker
    • {@link #getHoverline hoverline} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Line_hoverline
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Line.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Module sap.viz.ui5.types.Line

width.helpDescription: Set the width of the lines, ranging from '1' to '7'. If you enter a value outside that range, the line width defaults to '2'.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:

The value of a dimension may be

2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .

The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

formatString.description: Set the format strings for text in the tooltip. For dual axis charts, the first array is applied to the primary axis and the second array is applied to the second axis. If you enter fewer format strings into an array than there are measures in the respective axis, then the last format string is applied to all remaining measures. The following characters are reserved as tokens for format code: MDYHSAmdyhsa#?%0@.The following is an example of an array for a chart with two measures: [["#,##0.00 DM;-#,##.00 DM","#,##.00;-#,##.00"]].
formatString.helpDescription: Set the format strings for text in the tooltip. For dual axis charts, the first array is applied to the primary axis and the second array is applied to the second axis. If you enter fewer format strings into an array than there are measures in the respective axis, then the last format string is applied to all remaining measures. The following characters are reserved as tokens for format code: MDYHSAmdyhsa#?%0@.The following is an example of an array for a chart with two measures: [["#,##0.00 DM;-#,##.00 DM","#,##.00;-#,##.00"]].

postRender.description: A callback function can be specified as a parameter and passed to chart options when the user calls the createViz function. This callback function is called after the tooltip is rendered. The user can select and change dom elements' properties under the tooltip element.
postRender.helpDescription: A callback function can be specified as a parameter and passed to chart options when the user calls the createViz function. This callback function is called after the tooltip is rendered. The user can select and change dom elements' properties under the tooltip element.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

visible.description: Set the visibility of the tooltip
visible.helpDescription: Set the visibility of the tooltip

preRender.description: A callback function can be specified as a parameter and passed to chart options when the user calls the createViz function. This callback function is called before the tooltip is rendered. The input parameter is a dom element, which is at the bottom of the tooltip. Any dom element such as a button can be appended to this parent node. It can only be called when the tooltip is in actionMode.
preRender.helpDescription: A callback function can be specified as a parameter and passed to chart options when the user calls the createViz function. This callback function is called before the tooltip is rendered. The input parameter is a dom element, which is at the bottom of the tooltip. Any dom element such as a button can be appended to this parent node. It can only be called when the tooltip is in actionMode.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

sap.viz.ui5.data.CustomDataset.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/data/CustomDataset. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset#constructor sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset} can be used as well.

sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction_selectability Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction_selectability_mode (default: inclusive)
    • {@link #getAxisLabelSelection axisLabelSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLegendSelection legendSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPlotLassoSelection plotLassoSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPlotStdSelection plotStdSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLassoWithCtrlKey lassoWithCtrlKey} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDataPointsCacheable dataPointsCacheable} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Settings for selectability

mode.description: Set the selection mode. If this value is set to 'exclusive' or 'single', only one set of data points can be selected at once. If this value is set to 'inclusive' or 'multiple', multiple sets of data points can be selected at once. If this value is set to 'none', no sets of data points can be selected. The values 'single' and 'multiple' are deprecated; please remove them from your chart.
mode.helpDescription: Set the selection mode. If this value is set to 'exclusive' or 'single', only one set of data points can be selected at once. If this value is set to 'inclusive' or 'multiple', multiple sets of data points can be selected at once. If this value is set to 'none', no sets of data points can be selected. The values 'single' and 'multiple' are deprecated; please remove them from your chart.

sap.viz.ui5.Column.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Column Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.VerticalBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.Column.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'column'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Chart sap.viz.ui5.Column

Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_animation.description: Settings for animations in the plot area
sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_animation.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_animation Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataLoading dataLoading} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDataUpdating dataUpdating} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizing resizing} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar_animation.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Settings for animations in the plot area

SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

uid.description:
Uid of a feed item.
Please reference to bindings section in VIZDOCS to get the exact sUid string for each chart type.

For example:
	Bar chart > bindings > categoryAxis ; color ; valueAxis.
	The 'categoryAxis' should be the sUid for x axis feeding for bar chart.

sap.viz.ui5.types.layout.Dock.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Title.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Title Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getAlignment alignment} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title_alignment (default: center)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title_layout
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_scale Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFixedRange fixedRange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMinValue minValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMaxValue maxValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getFixedTicks fixedTicks} : object[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis_scale.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Set the scale of the value axis. This property only works on value type axes.

sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getSupportedEventNames supportedEventNames} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getEnableMouseMove enableMouseMove} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableMouseOver enableMouseOver} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableMouseOut enableMouseOut} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSupportLassoEvent supportLassoEvent} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHoldSelection holdSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPreserveSelectionWhenDragging preserveSelectionWhenDragging} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDecorations decorations} : any
    • {@link #getTriggers triggers} : any
    • {@link #getHandlers handlers} : any
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectability selectability} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction_selectability
    • {@link #getPan pan} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction_pan
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.

decorations.description:
Set decorations relating to interaction. Each item 
                that is an object of {name: 'decoration name', fn: 'decoration callback function'} is a decoration. 
                Currently two decorations are supported: showDetail and hideDetail. 
                These two decorations can be used to create a user-defined tooltip. 
                    
If these 2 decorations are used, the default tooltip is not used, 
                and the user should implement a custom tooltip. 
                The showDetail decoration is called when the tooltip is shown, 
                and the hideDetail decoration is called when the tooltip is hidden.
                    
The arguments of showDetail are one object of {mode: 'tooltip mode', 
                data: 'data of hovering selected data point', position: 'mouse position', 
                container: 'chart container dom element', selectedNumber: 'number of selected data points'}. 
                'tooltip mode' is either 'infoMode' or 'actionMode'. Hovering over an unselected data point displays the infoMode tooltip, 
                while hovering over a selected data point displays the actionMode tooltip.
                'data' is an array of dimensions and measures, where each item is an object of 
                {name: 'dimension name or measure name', value: 'dimension member or measure value',
                type: 'literal string of dimension or measure'}. For instance, 
                {name: 'Country', value: 'China', type: 'dimension'}, or 
                {name: 'Profit', value: 159, type: 'measure'}.
                    
The arguments of hideDetail are a string representing tooltip mode, 
                i.e. what kind of tooltip should be hidden.

If these 2 decorations are used, the default tooltip is not used,

formatString.description: Set the format strings for labels on the value axis. If a single format string is entered, it is applied to all measures. A two-dimensional array of format strings can be entered for scatter matrix charts and multiple charts with measureNamesDimension, to apply different formats to each sub-chart. For all other chart types, the first value of the first dimension of a two-dimensional array is used as a global format string. The following characters are reserved as tokens for format code: MDYHSAmdyhsa#?%0@. The letter "u" is used at the end of a format string to format values in SI units. If the letter "u" is added to a value between 1e12 and 1e-3 before SI units are applied, the value is formatted in exponential style. The remaining syntax matches Excel format strings. The following is a simple example of a two-dimensional array for a chart with two measures: [["#,##0.00 DM;-#,##.00 DM","#,##.00;-#,##.00"]].
formatString.helpDescription: Set the format strings for labels on the value axis. If a single format string is entered, it is applied to all measures. A two-dimensional array of format strings can be entered for scatter matrix charts and multiple charts with measureNamesDimension, to apply different formats to each sub-chart. For all other chart types, the first value of the first dimension of a two-dimensional array is used as a global format string. The following characters are reserved as tokens for format code: MDYHSAmdyhsa#?%0@. The letter "u" is used at the end of a format string to format values in SI units. If the letter "u" is added to a value between 1e12 and 1e-3 before SI units are applied, the value is formatted in exponential style. The remaining syntax matches Excel format strings. The following is a simple example of a two-dimensional array for a chart with two measures: [["#,##0.00 DM;-#,##.00 DM","#,##.00;-#,##.00"]].

visible.description: Set the visibility of the labels on this axis

unitFormatType.description: Set the unit format type. If set MetricUnits, unit K,M,G,T will be applied, eg, 5000 will display as 5K, 5000000 will display as 5M, 5000000000 will display as 5G and so on. If set FinancialUnits, unit K,M,B,T will be applied. 5000000000 will display as 5B.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getShapePalette shapePalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getMaxPriValue maxPriValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinPriValue minPriValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMaxSecValue maxSecValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinSecValue minSecValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTimeBased timeBased} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
    • {@link #getShowNegativeValues showNegativeValues} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMarkerSize markerSize} : int (default: 10)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter_animation
    • {@link #getAxisTooltip axisTooltip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter_axisTooltip
    • {@link #getHoverline hoverline} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter_hoverline
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Module sap.viz.ui5.types.Scatter

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:

The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.Area100.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Area100 Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Area
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.

Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

sap.viz.ui5.VizContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ui5/VizContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getVizType vizType} : string
    • {@link #getVizCss vizCss} : string
    • {@link #getVizProperties vizProperties} : object
    • {@link #getEnableMorphing enableMorphing} : boolean
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getVizData vizData} : sap.viz.ui5.data.Dataset
    • {@link #getAnalysisObjectsForPicker analysisObjectsForPicker} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.AnalysisObject[]
    • {@link #getFeeds feeds} : sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.feeds.FeedItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:feedsChanged feedsChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:vizTypeChanged vizTypeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:vizDefinitionChanged vizDefinitionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl#constructor sap.viz.ui5.controls.common.BaseControl} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.VizContainer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Controls ui5/VizContainer

feedsChanged.description:
Dispatches "feedsChanged" event when the feeding changes due to add/remove/change feeding items on feeding panel, drag and drop object onto VizFrame, or switch chart type by UI operation.
Application should listen to "feedsChanged" event to get the corresponding data and set it back to VizFrame to to update the visualization with the new data.

Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getIsDonut isDonut} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsGeoPie isGeoPie} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValign valign} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_valign (default: top)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Pie_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
    • {@link #getPlotScale plotScale} : float (default: 1)

SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. formatRules.description: Rules to format data points, sample:  [{condition: [{Key1:"Value1", Key2:"Value2"}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:"Value3"}], color:"#00ffff"}].  Each rule has two properties: "condition" and "color". The relation among the condition object in "condition" array is "OR",  which means the data point that met any condition in the array will apply the "color".  If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, the last rule would take effect.

sap.viz.ui5.DualBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.DualBar Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bar
    • {@link #getXAxis2 xAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.DualBar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'dual_bar'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Chart sap.viz.ui5.DualBar

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn100.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn100 Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getLegendGroup legendGroup} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Legend
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : sap.viz.ui5.types.legend.Common
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getDataLabel dataLabel} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Datalabel
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getXAxis xAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.StackedVerticalBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn100.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': '100_stacked_column'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.
Chart sap.viz.ui5.StackedColumn100

showTooltip.name: showTooltip
showTooltip.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}

sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartColor startColor} : string (default: #C2E3A9)
    • {@link #getEndColor endColor} : string (default: #73C03C)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[]
    • {@link #getLegendValues legendValues} : int[]
    • {@link #getFormatRules formatRules} : object[]
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBorder border} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap_border
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap_animation
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap_tooltip
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Heatmap.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

formatRules.description:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.
formatRules.helpDescription:
Sample value for formatRules: [{condition: [{Key1:Value1, Key2:Value2}], color:"#00ff00"}, {condition: [{Key3:Value3}], color:"#00ffff"}]. Each rule has two properties: the "condition" and the "color". Value1, Value2 and Value3 are values.
The value of a dimension may be
1, Single value (string), like "China" .
2. Array (enumeration), like ["UK","USA"] .
The value of a measure may be
1, Single value (number), like 20 .
2. Arry (enumeration), like [121,122] .
3. Object (range), like {min:100, max 200} . Min and max are inclusive. If users want to inlcude 200, but not 100 in the range, they may use {min:100.00001, max:200}. If users want values larger than 100, they may write {min:100}.
The color is applied if one or more conditions in the condition array is met. If multiple rules could apply on the same data point, it is the last rule that takes effect.

colorPalette.description: Set the color palette for the various sectors. For example, ["#748CB2", "#9CC677", "#EACF5E", "#F9AD79", "#D16A7C"].
colorPalette.helpDescription: Set the color palette for the various sectors. For example, ["#748CB2", "#9CC677", "#EACF5E", "#F9AD79", "#D16A7C"].

legendValues.description: Set the MBC legend values. For example, [10,11,12,13,14,15]. The values in the array should be in ascending order. If the number of values in the array is smaller than the MBC legend segment number, the MBC legend automatically calculates the values according to the data. If the number of values in the legendValues array is larger than MBC legend segment number, then only the first "segment number + 1" values are used.

sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet_orientation (default: vertical)
    • {@link #getColorPalette colorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getPrimaryValuesColorPalette primaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getSecondaryValuesColorPalette secondaryValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
    • {@link #getDrawingEffect drawingEffect} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet_drawingEffect (default: normal)
    • {@link #getIsRoundCorner isRoundCorner} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getReferenceValuesColorPalette referenceValuesColorPalette} : string[] (default: ???)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet_tooltip
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseStructuredType} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame} control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. sap.viz.ui5.Bullet.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.viz.ui5.Bullet Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGeneral general} : sap.viz.ui5.types.RootContainer
    • {@link #getInteraction interaction} : sap.viz.ui5.types.controller.Interaction
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Title
    • {@link #getToolTip toolTip} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Tooltip
    • {@link #getXyContainer xyContainer} : sap.viz.ui5.types.XYContainer
    • {@link #getYAxis yAxis} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getBackground background} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Background
    • {@link #getPlotArea plotArea} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Bullet
    • {@link #getXAxis2 xAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
    • {@link #getYAxis2 yAxis2} : sap.viz.ui5.types.Axis
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectData selectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deselectData deselectData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showTooltip showTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:hideTooltip hideTooltip} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart#constructor sap.viz.ui5.core.BaseChart} can be used as well.
sap.viz.ui5.Bullet.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.32.0 The chart controls in the sap.viz.ui5 package (which were always marked as experimental) have been deprecated since 1.32.0. They are no longer actively developed and won't receive new features or improvements, only important bug fixes. They will only remain in the SAPUI5 distribution for backward compatibility. SAP strongly recommends that existing consumers of those controls migrate to the new {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame VizFrame}(new sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame({'vizType': 'vertical_bullet'})) control to benefit from new charting enhancements and timely support. Note: As the feature set, design and API usage of VizFrame might differ from the old chart controls, make sure you evaluate it thoroughly before migration.

showTooltip.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.19 This Property has been deprecated. This interface will be removed from the SAPUI5 delivery in one of the next releases.
This event is deprecated, please use showDetail decoration (refer to properties: interaction.decorations) instead. Event fires when the mouse hover onto the specific part of chart, data context of tooltip would be passed in accordance with the following format.{name:"showTooltip",data:{body:[{ //All measures name:"...",val:[{//measure value is an array containing only one item value:"..."}]},"..."],footer:[{label:"...",value:"..."},"..."],plotArea:{ //this object specifies the plot area of the chart height:"...",width:"...",x:"...",y:"..."},point:{ //this object specifies a point which affects the position of tooltip x:"...",y:"..."},selectedValues:...//this number specify how many values are selected}}
